document.docAuthor: Giroti, André Marsola & Brescovit, Antonio Domingos
document.masterDocTitle: The taxonomy of the American Ariadna Audouin (Araneae: Synspermiata: Segestriidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The taxonomy of the American Ariadna Audouin (Araneae: Synspermiata: Segestriidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Dysdera crassipalpus Blackwall, 1863 : 43
( ♂ holotype from Rio de Janeiro , Brasil , deposited in Oxford Museum of Natural History, England , not examined).—
Beatty (1970: 483, as nomem dubium)
.
Ariadna crassipalpus—
Mello-Leitão (1947: 234, Transf. from
Dysdera
)
.—
Camargo (1950: 445, Descr. ♀ , =
A. mollis ,
present study)
.

Note. This species was identified based on the original description from Blackwall (1863) . The alotype described by Camargo (1950) was examined, and after the study of the internal genitalia it was observed that it represents a misidentification of an
Ariadna mollis
specimen.

Diagnosis.
Ariadna crassipalpa
is similar to
A. mollis
,
A. boesenbergi
,
A. calilegua
,
A. changellkuk , A. levii
and
A. perkinsi
due to the dark abdominal pattern with arrow-shaped marks ( Figs 1A‒C , 18A, F , 20A, F , 22A, F , 31A, E , 45A, F , 47A, F , 50A, F ), but differ, except
A. mollis
and
A. calilegua
, by the presence of males with sinuous metatarsi I, bearing a short and curved ventro-prolateral macrosetae in its median region, sometimes in a small apophysis ( Fig. 18C‒E ); it differs from
A. mollis
by presenting a more incrassated palpal tibia, with the dorsoventral diameter similar to the bulb, and from
A. calilegua
by having the curvature of the mid-portion and embolus less marked, and a thicker embolus ( Fig. 19A‒B ); females differ from these species, except
A. calilegua
, by having the anterior receptaculum with an irregular cuticle, with conspicuous grooves ( Fig. 19C‒D ); it differs from
A. calilegua
by the patellae I‒II without prolateral macrosetae ( Fig. 18H ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 18.
Ariadna crassipalpa (Blackwall, 1863)
. Male from Porto Alegre (MCN 3577) (A‒E): habitus, dorsal (A) and ventral view (B); right leg I, prolateral (C) and retrolateral view (D); right metatarsus I, ventral view (E), arrowhead = curved macroseta. Female from Canela (MCN 0551) (F‒I): habitus, dorsal (F) and ventral view (G); right leg I, prolateral (H) and retrolateral view (I). Scale bar: 1mm.

FIGURE 19.
Ariadna crassipalpa (Blackwall, 1863)
. Male from Porto Alegre (MCN 3577) (A‒B): left palp, prolateral (A) and retrolateral view (B). Female from Canela (MCN 0552) (C‒D): Internal genitalia, lateral view (C); Anterior receptaculum, ventral view (D). Scale bar: 1mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Variation. Male (n=10): Total length: 5.84‒8.72; carapace 3.2‒4.6 long, 2.32‒3.04 wide; femur I 3.24‒4.72. Female (n=10): Total length: 10.96‒14.8; carapace 5.36‒6.92 long, 3.44‒4.4 wide; femur I 3.68‒4.92.
Distribution. South and southeast of Brazil ( Fig. 72 ).
